","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgsdt","text":"For the samples stored at  , pour three   samples from the same sampling location into a sterile 1190 mL sample bag.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":26,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9p2ih","text":"If using a frozen water sample, fully thaw them at room temperature. For the frozen sample in a plastic sample bag, wipe the bag surface with 70% ethanol to remove dusts and sanitize the surface. Source three bags of   water samples from the same sampling location in a new 1190 ml sterile sample bag, then put the bagged samples in a suitable-sized container for defrosting. After samples are fully defrosted, pour the water samples into the 1190 ml outer bag and discard the original 250 ml sample bags. Hold the whole bag in a 1 L beaker. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":217,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cfufl","text":"Prepare 40% PEG-8000 solution for microbe aggregation. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ee1r","text":"Clean the work surfaces with RNaseZap, then wipe the surfaces with 70% molecular biology grade ethanol to remove additional contaminants.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7q7n9","text":"Transfer 0.1 mm zirconium oxide beads (2 spoons, Appendix 4) to Clear RINO brand 1.5 ml screw-cap microcentrifuge tubes.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":49,"length":10},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":49,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"anirp","text":"For the first time use of IndiMag pathogen kit, add 100% ethanol to Buffer AW1 and AW2, and add 100% Isopropanol to ACB as indicated on the bottles.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"91eb4","text":"Buffer ATL may form precipitates upon storage. If necessary, warm to   until the precipitates have fully dissolved. Prepare buffer ATL-DX: add   Reagent DX to   Buffer ATL. If smaller amounts are needed, transfer   of Buffer ATL into a sterile 2 ml vial and add   Reagent DX. Mix well, after the addition of Reagent DX. After preparation, the mixture is stable for 6 months at   (15-25°C).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":69,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":143,"length":1},{"key":6,"offset":159,"length":1},{"key":7,"offset":213,"length":1},{"key":8,"offset":262,"length":1},{"key":9,"offset":377,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6sj08","text":"MagAttract Suspension G from the IndiMag pathogen kit needs to be vortexed thoroughly for   (before first use) or 1 minute (before subsequent uses) to ensure that the magnetic silica particles are fully resuspended.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":10,"offset":90,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fopqk","text":"Binding beads need to be vortexed thoroughly before each use. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gjgh","text":"Prepare a few 15 ml or 50 ml conical centrifuge tubes with nuclease-free water for preparing TNA elution in KingFisher Flex or KingFisher Duo Prime to avoid cross-contamination.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70d99","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":5,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":6,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"eai4m","text":"NOTE: ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":119,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"18hpu","text":"To prevent cross contamination, nucleic acid extraction and amplification (PCR) should be performed in separate rooms. ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":182,"offset":0,"style":"italic"}],"key":"6ecej","text":"Processing can be done prior to freezing samples to save freezer space.
